Experience Senior Vendor Operations Leader - Australia / New Zealand Google November 2014  – Present (10 months) Manila - Philippines - Drive customer acquisitions through effective management, business partnering and overall support of the Vendor operation to meet and exceed sales targets. 
- Set up of the Sales Team. I've recruited, managed and trained a team of 40 sales reps, 1 operation manager, 3 team leaders and 1 trainer. 
- Liaison between the Vendor and Country Marketing Team. 
- Coordinate with relevant internal Google departments such as Billing, Product Management, Policy teams, etc. 
- Regularly review and evaluation of the service quality of the vendor against contracted SLAs. 
- Analysis and presentation of the weekly performance figures to the senior management team. 
- Participation in weekly updates and monthly business reviews between Google and the outsourcing partner. 
- Highlight & top line key business insights to stakeholders and management on a weekly basis. 
- Deliver induction training for new sales reps, especially with regards to AdWords/YouTube product training, campaign building, and regular product & policy updates. 
- Serve as onsite Google representative providing Google-specific product and tool support for our vendor partner. 
- The settting up of a second vendor in Sydney and participation in the RFP process. Vendor Operations Leader - Australia / New Zealand Google January 2013  – Present (2 years 8 months) Manila - Philippines Vendor Operations Leader - North America Google July 2012  –  December 2012  (6 months) Phoenix - United States - In charge of the AdWords Express Outbound sales team (50+ FTEs) Vendor Operations Leader - Italy Google October 2011  –  June 2012  (9 months) Milan Area, Italy Senior Campaign Strategist NBS (New Business Sales) Google September 2010  –  September 2011  (1 year 1 month) Dublin - Built and optimised client AdWords accounts by analysing and managing their campaign strategy. 
- Improved the advertisers' individual ad and campaign performance. 
- Built relevant, researched keyword lists and groupings and created/edited text for client advertising campaigns. 
- Evangelized the client in regards of all the last AdWords' features.  
- Responsible for the upsell of other Google products (YouTube/Mobile/Google Apps). 
- Interviewed and participated to the hiring process of new potential Googlers. 
 
In regards of the work done with the digital agencies: 
 
- Coached, trained and mentored new agency hires. 
- Worked with Marketing to train agencies, increase their awareness and adoption of Google’s portfolio of advertising solutions. 
- Organized, coordinated and lead agency events. Providing them with superior consultancy services and using their analytical skills and deep knowledge of the vertical/ Internet, help advertisers grow their business and maximize the return on their marketing investment. You also work in partnership with the advertiser to understand their strategies and increase their understanding of Google advertising solutions. You are able to sell effectively by delivering value through high-quality strategic advice and creative advertising solutions. Ideally, you have an online marketing background and a thorough knowledge of the advertising business.

- ​Constantly think of creative ways to improve our relationships with our clients and grow client revenue. 
- Persuade clients of the wider strategic opportunities in relation to AdWords. 
​- Improve clients' campaign performance and return on investment. The success of Project Chauffeur led Google to create one of the top applied sciences R&D labs in the world, Google[x]. I became the head of operations for Google[x]. Senior Program Manager, Ground Truth (Google Maps) Google June 2008  –  April 2009  (11 months) Hyderabad, India Oversaw operations for the largest map making team in the world. Increased size of "GT Ops" to roughly 1000 employees in less than a year, while simultaneously creating geometric increases in cartographer productivity and program cost-efficiency through semi-automated training and testing. If you prefer Google Maps to the recently-launched Apple maps, this may be because we've invested thousands of years of work to make the most useful map in history. :-) Operations Manager, Offline Ads Google January 2006  –  May 2008  (2 years 5 months) New York, NY Fresh off revolutionizing the internet, and online advertising, Google began reinventing traditional media too.  
 
We created online markets (first a dutch auction, then automated bourse) for offline media; forged partnerships with every newspaper in the country, minus one; then automated the creation and reformatting of magazine and newspaper ads to reduce transaction costs and create a competitive advantage over the status quo. However, marrying online advertisers dependent on conversion metrics, to print publishers and traditional agencies dependent on opaque pricing models simply didn't work. It could have been different if cell phones and QR codes worked better then, or if the print industry leadership had been braver, or if our products had been more magical... but as it was Google Offline Ads was "a bridge too far" -- undeniably a failed strategic initiative for Google. In some ways, I wasted 2.5 years of my career. 
 
On the other hand, I learned more about management in 2008 than I had during the previous 20 years combined. This experience, combined with what followed, taught me to move faster (even if that means losing faster), and to plan and execute every day like the life of your business is at stake. Because it is. Sales Operations Manager Google June 2003  –  March 2006  (2 years 10 months) New York, NY I started my career at pre-IPO Google as a contractor, hired to help our ad sales team automate its internal systems, standardize practices and contract administration across disconnected offices, and document internal process controls for SOX compliance. I became a Google employee in Tim Armstrong's Direct Sales organization (DSO), as a Process and Compliance Specialist in the Sales Finance organization. After the IPO, I took on increasingly senior roles in more complex projects, creating multiple >$100M sales channels for Google ads products. I developed expertise entering new markets with novel sales and customer-support approaches, creating large teams with scaleable internal systems during hypergrowth periods; and during this time I was promoted twice.  
 
In general, my specialty is semi-automation, combining human "brute force" approaches with Google's unique engineering and infrastructure resources. I try to not prematurely optimize, which allows even large teams to move really fast-- tolerate tactical inefficiencies while achieving strategic victories.
